text: Barmeath Castle Barmeath Castle is a country house near Dunleer in the centre of County Louth. Of note are the castle's 10 acres of gardens designed by the 18th-century landscape architect Thomas Wright. Barmeath Castle was erected in the 15th century and the Bellew family have lived there since 1670. It is the ancestral seat of the Barons Bellew. == References == Category:Country houses in Ireland Category:Buildings and structures in County Louth Category:15th- century establishments in Ireland Category:Buildings and structures completed in the 15th century
title: Barmeath Castle
